info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:51PM EDT until July 25 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN STAFFORD...SOUTHEASTERN FAUQUIER...EASTERN CULPEPER AND NORTHEASTERN SPOTSYLVANIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FREDERICKSBURG... At 450 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northwest of Fredericksburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Fredericksburg, Falmouth, Stones Corner, Leeland, Spring Valley, Brooke, Ramoth, Storck, Holly Corner, Dunavant, Glendie, Hartwood and Brookfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
